chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant James Victor Thomas Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Provide DNA sample.
Full-time work/school (minimum of 25 hours of work per week if in school).

Obtain a valid driver's license.
Complete 8 hours of driver's education.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Victor Thomas Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Victor Thomas in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant James Victor Thomas in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 166 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION IF REVOKED: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 25 hours of work per week if in school).
- Complete 120 hours of community service.  
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete 8 HOURS of driver's education.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Notice of right to seek post conviction relief
Email correspondence with parties. Rescheduled plea and sentencing hearing for June 22nd, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant James Victor Thomas not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for Grace Gall for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant James Victor Thomas not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 40. Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8th, 8:30 am.

Court scheduled bail/bond hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.

Defendant James Victor Thomas in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant James Victor Thomas in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Lucena-Martinez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

ADDRESS INFO for James Victor Thomas Jr
Current: 9075 W. Howard Ave #105, Milwaukee, WI 53228   (Effective: 01-15-2022)
Prior: 9227 North 75th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant James Victor Thomas in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant James Victor Thomas in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Victor Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
